metadata.description:
I wrote 'In the Leaves' about a dream I had before I decided to quit my stable, full-time design job.

In the dream I kept waking up outside — on the sidewalk in San Francisco, and later in the leaves by a road. I kept choosing that over my bed, and it felt surprisingly calm to wake up outside of my home.

I had a session with Benji Cormack and we talked about this dream and how it seemed to mirror my life choice of staying in the comfort of a full-time job or leaving to focus on music and being satisfied with less.

I quit the job and now I've put out the song.

"I'm waking in the leaves again
Under street signs, never needed more.
Mapping out the turns I take
When I sleepwalk, why's it feel like home?"

Written by: Benji Cormack, Lyrah
Produced by: Nick Booth, Benji Cormack, Jon Wienner, Lyrah
Artwork by: Brendan Lowry

lyrics.text:
[Verse 1]
If I could live like
Present day was dead
No pressure to take in
The moments we'll forget

[Pre-Chorus]
And I'll stop and call
Just to open my lungs
I threw it all
'Cause I don't know what I've won

[Chorus]
I'm waking in the leaves again
Under street signs, never needed more
Mapping out the turns I take
When I sleepwalk, why's it feel like home?

Racing my fears, have I rehearsed this?
Playing out a story now

I threw it all
